intro: Collinsonia, commonly known as sweet pepperbush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Collinsonia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
